intro: Acrodon bellidiflorus var. striatus, commonly known as the striped bellidiflorus, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers display a range of colors from white to pink. This variety is distinguished by its distinctive longitudinal stripes on the petals, which contribute to its ornamental value.
